name: Non-Medical Style Expectations
prompt: Elaborate 5 theoretical slides where you show the Infective Endocarditis disease to NON-MEDICAL_STUDENTs. Your generation should respect all detailed slide information below, including the structure as follows (do not enclose in code "```"): Slide format:""" --- **Slide {{slide_number}}: {{slide_title}}** {{slide_body}} """ ### Body Restrictions ### - Every slide_body has at most 25 words in a slide with at least 7 lines. - Use bullet-list form as the primary textual element type. - As pedagogical presentations seek attention and conveyance clarity beyond text, you are free to fill lines of any slide_body using the given structural elements (not counting to the word limit): - Images: """ **** {{image_caption}} **** """ - Tables: """ **** {{var1}}/{{var2}} **** """ - Make the slides sound complete to the readers with concise information sustained on diverse images or tables. ### Considerations & Requirements ### - All information in the generated slides should be clear, nonredundant, and appropriate to a professional and engaging medical presentation. - Assume non-medical students could be nurses, microbiologists, or cardio-pneumologists. - The first slide should have the presentation overview. - An analogy is required as the last slide, relating this cardiovascular pathology to the studies of students pursuing microbiology. ### Non-Medical Target Style ### Please ensure no overwhelming medical jargon and a simple, engaged tone when creating slides.
